items.text: short, angles in on middle and leg and sits up nicely. Mithun crunches a pull and helps it over deep square leg

items.text: short of a length, gets on top and defends awkwardly into the off side

items.text: shortish, not enough room and pacy, tries to pull and the ball gets over the bat
items.shortText: Chameera to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: dropped. But a brilliant effort. That was absolutely hammered. Didn't even have the time to blink. Tamim charged down but took himself away from the line a tad too much. As a result, he drills it straight back to the right of the bowler but off the toe end of the bat. Chameera gets down to his right valiabtly but a split-second earlier would have given him a better chance
items.shortText: Chameera to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: and Tamim looks a gift horse in the mouth. Gives his wicket away next ball. Shortish with zero room. Tamim tries to force a pull. The runs weren't coming and he was desperate. Manages a healthy top-edge that is taken at midwicket
items.shortText: Chameera to Tamim Iqbal, OUT

dismissal.text: Tamim Iqbal c Dananjaya b Chameera 3 (18b 0x4 0x6) SR: 16.66

items.text: edged and short. Pushes way away from the body, a length ball that nips away subtly from a fifth-stump channel. Gets an edge that drops short of second slip diving forward
items.shortText: Chameera to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: wears it on the pad as he tries to flick this with the angle
items.shortText: Chameera to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: short of a length, tries to flick but the ball slides in to hit the pad on its way to square leg
items.shortText: Chameera to Mohammad Mithun, 1 leg bye

items.text: short, wide, chops a slap with a half-angled bat to cover
items.shortText: Lakmal to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: good length on the fourth-stump line, punched into the covers
items.shortText: Lakmal to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.preText: Talha Khan: "Anyone remembered M.Amir after that drop and gone ! Ahh This is final too" And both the best batsmen of their respective sides.

items.postText: Kay-lom: "This wicket is two paced and not very easy to score runs from. If Thisara doesn't bowl full tosses this will be ideal for him and Asela to slow down the scoring in the middle."
items.shortText: Lakmal to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: short of good length, nips away and he opens up for a punch through backward point

items.text: short of a length, keeps lower than he thought it'd, and rushes him with pace as he swings early on the pull

items.text: good length, a neat front-foot defence into the covers. A sloppy effort in the field gives them a single that never should have been

items.text: short ball, gets well over off, no stroke attempted
items.shortText: Chameera to Sabbir Rahman, no run

items.preText: jalim: "IMO, I don't think BD have the temperament to win just yet - something unexpected or a mistake occurs and they're all defensive the next moment. Last match, got all out for 80-odd because of Tamim and Shakib getting out early, and the other batsmen forgetting how to cope. Today, they hear Shakib isn't able to bat, and they start the innings off not even trying to rotate the strike. Seems Sri Lanka and Bangladesh exchanged mindsets during the middle of the tournament..." Probably a bit harsh to say they don't have temperament to win matches. There is room for improvement, yes, but remember this is the same team that beat New Zealand in tough conditions in the Champions Trophy.
items.text: oh, a run out. Bangladesh really didn't need this. A direct hit catches him well short of the crease. And it's Thisara Perera, Sri Lanka's golden boy this series. A length ball that's knocked to mid-off. He decides to take on the fielder there and as it turns out, it'll be the last thing he does this innings. Perera charges in, swoops down and has one stump to aim at
items.shortText: Lakmal to Mohammad Mithun, OUT
